title: Provides for the recanvass of certain ballots upon request of a candidate prior to the canvass of absentee and special ballots
summary: Provides for the recanvass of certain ballots upon request of a candidate prior to the canvas of absentee and special ballots in the city of New York.

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to recanvass of votes cast
         on voting machines

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  9-209 of the election law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 3 to read as follows:
    3    3. UPON RECEIPT OF A WRITTEN REQUEST BY A CANDIDATE FOR PUBLIC OFFICE,
    4  THE BOARD OF ELECTIONS IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK  SHALL  FIRST  CONDUCT  A
    5  RECANVASS OF VOTES CAST ON VOTING MACHINES USED IN THE ELECTION FOR SAID
    6  PUBLIC  OFFICE,  AS  PROVIDED  IN SECTION 9-208 OF THIS TITLE, AND SHALL
    7  NOTIFY, IN WRITING, EACH CANDIDATE FOR SAID PUBLIC OFFICE OF THE  RESULT
    8  OF  THE RECANVASS PRIOR TO THE CANVASS OF ANY BALLOT AS PROVIDED IN THIS
    9  SECTION. SUCH WRITTEN REQUEST SHALL BE SUBSTANTIALLY  IN  THE  FOLLOWING
   10  FORM:
   11    I, ___________, A CANDIDATE FOR THE PUBLIC OFFICE OF ___________________
   12       (NAME)                                                (OFFICE)
   13  IN THE ___________________ DISTRICT, AT THE ______________________ PARTY
   14         (NAME AND NUMBER)                   (PARTY NAME IF PRIMARY)
   15  PRIMARY/ GENERAL/ SPECIAL ELECTION HELD ON ________________, REQUEST THE
   16                                                  (DATE)
   17  BOARD  OF  ELECTION  IN  THE CITY OF NEW YORK CONDUCT A RECANVASS OF ALL
   18  VOTES CAST ON VOTING MACHINES FOR THE ABOVE STATED PUBLIC  OFFICE  PRIOR
   19  TO  THE  CANVASS  OF  ANY PAPER BALLOTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 9-209 OF THE
   20  ELECTION LAW.

   23    S 2. This act shall  take  effect  on  the  first  of  September  next

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1328

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the election law, in relation to recanvass of votes cast on
voting machines

PURPOSE:

Requires the Board of Elections in the City of New York, upon written
request by a candidate for public office, to recanvass voting machines
prior to opening paper ballots.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Amends section 9-209 of the Election Law by adding a new subdivision 3
to require the Board of Elections in the City of New York, upon receipt
of a written request by a candidate for public office, to conduct the
recanvass of voting machines, as provided in section 9-208 of the
Election Law, and notify all candidates, in writing, of the result of
the recanvass, prior to the canvas of absentee, military and special
ballots and "affidavit" ballots. Provides for a form to be used for such
request.

EXISTING LAW:

There is no provision as to the order of the canvas of paper ballots and
the recanvass of machines.

JUSTIFICATION:

In the City of New York, all of these paper ballots are opened at the
Board of Elections. This bill would allow all candidates to know the
final machine count prior to opening paper ballots. The candidates will
have better information to determine if initiation of court proceedings
is required and have a greater understanding regarding the effect of
challenges when paper ballots are opened.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:

2009/10 - S/1428/A.4960 - Advanced to 3rd Reading
2007/08 - S.1499/A,6727
2005/06 - S.6596/A.9756

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

LOCAL FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

The first of September next succeeding the date on which it shall have
become a law.
